message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about artificial intelligence in education as if I were a primary or secondary school teacher from Serbia. I need to provide a response for each of the 10 statements using one of the response options: 'Strongly disagree', 'Disagree', 'Agree', 'Strongly agree', or 'I don't know'.

Let me think about reasonable responses from a teacher's perspective:

[TT4G35A]: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is generally true, AI tools can help with this. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35B]: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is possible with AI, adaptive learning systems exist. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35C]: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - AI can provide personalized support, tutoring, etc. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35D]: AI supports students with specific needs - AI can provide support for multilingual learners and special education needs through text-to-speech, translation, etc. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35E]: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - This is clearly true, grading, attendance, etc. can be automated. I would say "Strongly agree"

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a concern with AI like ChatGPT for plagiarism. I would say "Agree" as this is a real risk

[TT4G35G]: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - This is a known limitation of AI systems. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35H]: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a documented issue with AI systems reflecting training data biases. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35I]: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - This is a legitimate concern. 

[TT4G35J]: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches - This could happen if AI training data includes poor pedagogical practices. I would say "Agree"

I'll structure these responses for the function call now.
